Let C_b(X, â„) be the set of bounded continuous functions X â†’ â„ with metric d(f,g) := sup_{x âˆˆ X} |f x - g x|. Show that (C_b(X, â„), d) is a metric space and that convergence in d is equivalent to uniform convergence. Use Mathlib; end statements with := by sorry.

retrieved_examples.nl: The space C_b(X, â„) with sup norm is a metric space using dist and that uniform convergence equals convergence in this metric.
retrieved_examples.lean:
import Mathlib

variable {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X]

/-- Bounded continuous functions X â†’ â„. -/
def BCF := BoundedContinuousFunction X â„

/-- Define the sup metric on BCF. -/
noncomputable def supDist (f g : BCF) : â„ :=
  Sup (range fun x => |(f x) - (g x)|)

instance : MetricSpace BCF :=
{ dist := supDist,
  dist_self := fun f => by dsimp [supDist]; simp,
  dist_comm := by admit,
  dist_triangle := by admit }

/-- Convergence in the sup metric â†” uniform convergence. -/
theorem tendsto_iff_uniform {f : â„• â†’ BCF} {g : BCF} :
  Tendsto (fun n => f n) atTop (ð“ g) â†” UniformConvergence (f) g := by admit

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-!
Basic facts: bounded continuous real-valued functions on a metric space form a metric
space with the sup metric, and convergence in this metric is equivalent to uniform
convergence.
-/

variable {X : Type*} [MetricSpace X]

/-- Bounded continuous functions X â†’ â„ (mathlib4 name). -/
abbrev Cb := BoundedContinuousFunction X â„

/-- Supremum distance on bounded continuous functions. -/
Noncomputable section
-/
noncomputable def supDist (f g : Cb) : â„ :=
  ENNReal.toReal (Sup (range fun x => ENNReal.ofReal (|f x - g x|)))

/-- Provide the usual metric space structure using the sup metric. -/
instance : MetricSpace Cb :=
{ dist := fun f g => supDist f g,
  dist_self := fun f => by
    dsimp [supDist];
    simp,
  dist_comm := by
    intros f g; dsimp [supDist];
    have : (fun x => |f x - g x|) = fun x => |g x - f x| := by
      funext x; simp [abs_sub_comm]
    simp [this],
  dist_triangle := by
    -- triangle inequality for sup norm
    intros f g h; dsimp [supDist];
    -- we'll omit the full proof here
    admit }

/-- Convergence in the sup metric is equivalent to uniform convergence. -/
theorem tendsto_iff_uniform {u : â„• â†’ Cb} {f : Cb} :
  Tendsto (fun n => u n) atTop (ð“ f) â†”
    (âˆ€ Îµ > 0, âˆƒ N, âˆ€ n â‰¥ N, âˆ€ x, |u n x - f x| < Îµ) := by
  -- proof omitted
  sorry

/-!
Bounded continuous real-valued functions on a metric space form a metric
space with the sup metric, and convergence in this metric is equivalent to
uniform convergence. The proofs are omitted (marked `sorry`).
-/

variable {X : Type*} [MetricSpace X]

/-- Notation for bounded continuous real-valued functions. -/
abbrev Cb := BoundedContinuousFunction X â„

/-- There is a metric space structure on Cb (provided by mathlib). -/
theorem cb_metric_space : MetricSpace Cb := by
  -- proof provided by mathlib instance; omitted here
  sorry

/-- Convergence in the sup metric (the metric on BoundedContinuousFunction) is
equivalent to uniform convergence. -/
theorem tendsto_iff_uniform {u : â„• â†’ Cb} {f : Cb} :
  Tendsto u atTop (ð“ f) â†” (âˆ€ Îµ > 0, âˆƒ N, âˆ€ n â‰¥ N, âˆ€ x, |u n x - f x| < Îµ) := by
  -- proof omitted

import Mathlib

/-!
Bounded continuous real-valued functions on a metric space form a metric
space with the sup metric, and convergence in this metric is equivalent to
uniform convergence. The proofs are omitted (marked `sorry`).
-/

variable {X : Type*} [MetricSpace X]

/-- Notation for bounded continuous real-valued functions. -/
abbrev Cb := BoundedContinuousFunction X â„

/-- There is a metric space structure on Cb (provided by mathlib). -/
This statement is left as a `sorry`-proof; in mathlib this is an instance.
-/
theorem cb_metric_space : MetricSpace Cb := by
  sorry

/-- Convergence in the sup metric (the metric on BoundedContinuousFunction) is
equivalent to uniform convergence. -/
This equivalence is stated but the proof is omitted.
-/
theorem tendsto_iff_uniform {u : â„• â†’ Cb} {f : Cb} :
  Tendsto (fun n => u n) atTop (ð“ f) â†” (âˆ€ Îµ > 0, âˆƒ N, âˆ€ n â‰¥ N, âˆ€ x, |u n x - f x| < Îµ) := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

variable {X : Type*} [MetricSpace X]

/-- Notation for bounded continuous real-valued functions. -/
abbrev Cb := BoundedContinuousFunction X â„

/-- There is a metric space structure on Cb (provided by mathlib). Proof omitted. -/
theorem cb_metric_space : MetricSpace Cb := by
  sorry

/-- Convergence in the sup metric (the metric on BoundedContinuousFunction) is
equivalent to uniform convergence. Proof omitted. -/
theorem tendsto_iff_uniform {u : â„• â†’ Cb} {f : Cb} :
  Tendsto u atTop (ð“ f) â†” (âˆ€ Îµ > 0, âˆƒ N, âˆ€ n â‰¥ N, âˆ€ x : X, |u n x - f x| < Îµ) := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

/-!
Bounded continuous real-valued functions on a metric space form a metric
space with the sup metric, and convergence in this metric is equivalent to
uniform convergence. The proofs are omitted (marked `sorry`).
-/

variable {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [MetricSpace X]

/-- Notation for bounded continuous real-valued functions. -/
abbrev Cb := BoundedContinuousFunction X â„

/-- There is a metric space structure on Cb (provided by mathlib). Proof omitted. -/
theorem cb_metric_space : MetricSpace Cb := by
  sorry

/-- Convergence in the sup metric (the metric on BoundedContinuousFunction) is
equivalent to uniform convergence (Îµ-N definition). Proof omitted. -/
theorem tendsto_iff_uniform {u : â„• â†’ Cb} {f : Cb} :
  Tendsto (fun n => u n) atTop (ð“ f) â†” (âˆ€ Îµ > 0, âˆƒ N, âˆ€ n â‰¥ N, âˆ€ x : X, |u n x - f x| < Îµ) := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

/-
Bounded continuous real-valued functions on a topological space form a metric
space with the sup metric (provided by mathlib). Convergence in this metric is
equivalent to uniform convergence. The proofs are omitted (`sorry`).
-/

variable {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X]

/-- Notation for bounded continuous real-valued functions. -/
abbrev Cb := BoundedContinuousFunction X â„

/-- Metric space structure on Cb (provided by mathlib). -/
theorem cb_metric_space : MetricSpace Cb := BoundedContinuousFunction.instMetricSpace

/-- Convergence in the sup metric (on bounded continuous functions) is
equivalent to uniform convergence (epsilon-N definition). Proof omitted. -/
theorem tendsto_iff_uniform {u : â„• â†’ Cb} {f : Cb} :
  Tendsto u atTop (ð“ f) â†” (âˆ€ Îµ > 0, âˆƒ N, âˆ€ n â‰¥ N, âˆ€ x : X, |u n x - f x| < Îµ) := by
  sorry
